intro: Cephaelis bracteocardia, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fan-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and conservation efforts.
